text: "Save That Shit" is the fourth single off of American rapper Lil Peep's first studio album Come Over When You're Sober, Pt. 1. The song was released on August 12, 2017. The song was able to make it to #9 on the Bubbling Under R&B;/Hip-Hop Singles, #75 on the Sverigetopplistan, and #97 on the Canadian Hot 100 charts. It was also certified Platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). In the song, Peep raps about a relationship with a girl. He wonders if the girl wants to be with him and how he can make her happy. He says that his life is a mess and she can't save him. A music video was released for the song after Peep's death. It was directed by Mezzy and Heavy Rayn. The video starts with a message from Peep's mom that says "In loving memory of my son Gus". A phone gets text messages from a woman. Footage of Peep performing in concert and of him on the road during tour is shown. A woman is shown doing different things like working and hanging out with friends. The whole time she is always on her phone texting and waiting for texts from Peep. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:2017 songs Category:Hip hop songs
